intro: Actinostigma lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceolate actinostigma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its role in local ecosystems. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in plant morphology and ecological interactions.
